setting.name: bannedusernames
setting.title: Banned Usernames
setting.description: Ban users from registering certain usernames. You must seperate usernames with a comma.

setting.name: bannedips
setting.title: Ban by IP
setting.description: Here, you may specify IP addresses or a range of IP addresses. You must separate each IP with a comma.

setting.name: bannedemails
setting.title: Ban by Email
setting.description: You may specify specific email addresses to ban, or you may specify a domain. You must separate email addresses and domains with a comma.

setting.name: emailkeep
setting.title: Users Keep Email
setting.description: If a current user has an email already registered in your banned list, should he be allowed to keep it.

settinggroup.name: onlineoffline
settinggroup.title: Board Online / Offline
settinggroup.description: These settings allow you to globally turn your forums online or offline, and allow you to specify a reason for turning them off.

setting.name: boardclosed
setting.title: Board Closed
setting.description:
If you need to close your forums to make some changes or perform an upgrade, this is the global switch. Viewers will not be able to view your forums, however, they will see a message with the reason you specify below.

Administrators will still be able to view the forums.

setting.name: boardclosed_reason
setting.title: Board Closed Reason
setting.description: If your forum is closed, you can set a message here that your visitors will be able to see when they visit your forums.
setting.settingvalue: These forums are currently closed for maintenance. Please check back later.

settinggroup.name: calendar
settinggroup.title: Calendar
settinggroup.description: The board calendar allows the public and private listing of events and members' birthdays. This section allows you to control and manage the settings for the Calendar.

setting.name: enablecalendar
setting.title: Enable Calendar Functionality
setting.description: If you wish to disable the calendar on your board, set this option to no.

setting.name: publiceventcolor
setting.title: Public Events Color
setting.description: The color that public events will be shown in on the main calendar page.

setting.name: privateeventcolor
setting.title: Private Events Color
setting.description: The color that private events will be shown in on the main calendar page.

setting.name: smilieinserter
setting.title: Clickable Smilies Inserter
setting.description: Clickable smilies will appear on the posting pages if this option is set to 'on'.

setting.name: smilieinsertertot
setting.title: No. of Smilies to show
setting.description: Enter the total number of smilies to show on the clickable smilie inserter.

setting.name: smilieinsertercols
setting.title: No. of Smilie Cols to Show
setting.description: Enter the number of columns you wish to show on the clickable smilie inserter.

setting.name: cplanguage
setting.title: Control Panel Language
setting.description: The language of the control panel.

setting.name: cpstyle
setting.title: Control Panel Style
setting.description: The Default style that the control panel will use. Styles are inside the styles folder. A folder name inside that folder becomes the style title and style.css inside the style title folder is the css style file.

settinggroup.name: datetime
settinggroup.title: Date and Time Formats
settinggroup.description: Here you can specify the different date and time formats used to display dates and times on the forums.

setting.name: dateformat
setting.title: Date Format
setting.description: The format of the dates used on the forum. This format uses the PHP date() function. We recommend not changing this unless you know what you're doing.

setting.name: timeformat
setting.title: Time Format
setting.description: The format of the times used on the forum. This format uses PHP's date() function. We recommend not changing this unless you know what you're doing.

setting.name: regdateformat
setting.title: Registered Date Format
setting.description: The format used on showthread where it shows when the user registered.

setting.name: dstcorrection
setting.title: Day Light Savings Time
setting.description: If times are an hour out above and your timezone is selected correctly, enable day light savings time correction.

settinggroup.name: forumdisplay
settinggroup.title: Forum Display Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the forum display (forumdisplay.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: threadsperpage
setting.title: Threads Per Page
setting.description: The number of threads to display per page on the forum display

setting.name: hottopic
setting.title: Replies For Hot Topic
setting.description: The number of replies that is needed for a topic to be considered 'hot'.

setting.name: hottopicviews
setting.title: Views For Hot Topic
setting.description: The number of views a thread can have before it is considered 'hot'.

setting.name: usertppoptions
setting.title: User Selectable Threads Per Page
setting.description: If you would like to allow users to select how many threads per page are shown in a forum, enter the options they should be able to select separated with commas. If this is left blank they will not be able to choose how many threads are shown per page.

setting.name: dotfolders
setting.title: Use 'dot' Icons
setting.description: Do you want to show dots on the thread indicators of threads users have participated in.

setting.name: browsingthisforum
setting.title: Users Browsing this Forum
setting.description: Here you can turn off the 'users browsing this forum' feature.

setting.name: announcementlimit
setting.title: Announcements Limit
setting.description: The number of forum announcements to show in the thread listing on the forum display pages. Set to 0 to disable announcements altogether.

settinggroup.name: forumhome
settinggroup.title: Forum Home Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the forum home (index.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: showdescriptions
setting.title: Show Forum Descriptions?
setting.description: This option will allow you to turn off showing the descriptions for forums.

setting.name: subforumsindex
setting.title: Subforums to show on Index listing
setting.description: The number of subforums that you wish to show inside forums on the index and forumdisplay pages. Set to 0 to not show the subforum list

setting.name: subforumsstatusicons
setting.title: Show Subforum Status Icons?
setting.description: Show icons indicating whether or not a subforum contains new posts or not? This won't have any effect unless you enabled subforums display on the index.

setting.name: hideprivateforums
setting.title: Hide Private Forums?
setting.description: You can hide private forums by turning this option on. This option also hides forums on the forum jump and all subforums.

setting.name: modlist
setting.title: Forums' Moderator Listing
setting.description: Here you can turn on or off the listing of moderators for each forum on index.php and forumdisplay.php

setting.name: showbirthdays
setting.title: Show Today's Birthdays?
setting.description: Do you want to show today's birthdays on the forum homepage?

setting.name: showwol
setting.title: Show Who's Online?
setting.description: Display the currently active users on the forum home page.

setting.name: showindexstats
setting.title: Show Small Stats Section
setting.description: Do you want to show the total number of threads, posts, members, and the last member on the forum home?

setting.name: showforumviewing
setting.title: Show x viewing forum
setting.description: Displays the currently active users viewing each forum.

settinggroup.name: general
settinggroup.title: General Configuration
settinggroup.description: This section contains various settings such as your board name and url, as well as your website name and url.

setting.name: bbname
setting.title: Board Name
setting.description: The name of your message boards. We recommend that it is not over 75 characters.

setting.name: bburl
setting.title: Board URL
setting.description:
The url to your forums.
Include the http://. Do NOT include a trailing slash.

setting.name: homename
setting.title: Homepage Name
setting.description: The name of your homepage. This will appear in the footer with a link to it.

setting.name: homeurl
setting.title: Homepage URL
setting.description: The full URL of your homepage. This will be linked to in the footer along with its name.

setting.name: adminemail
setting.title: Admin Email
setting.description: The administrator's email address. This will be used for outgoing emails sent via the forums.

setting.name: contactlink
setting.title: Contact Us Link
setting.description: This will be used for the Contact Us link on the bottom of all the forum pages. Can either be an email address (using mailto:email@website.com) or a hyperlink.

setting.name: bblanguage
setting.title: Default Language
setting.description: The default language that MyBB should use for guests and for users without a selected language in their user control panel.

setting.name: cookiedomain
setting.title: Cookie Domain
setting.description: The domain which cookies should be set to. This can remain blank. It should also start with a . so it covers all subdomains.

setting.name: cookiepath
setting.title: Cookie Path
setting.description: The path which cookies are set to, we recommend setting this to the full directory path to your forums with a trailing slash.

setting.name: showvernum
setting.title: Show Version Numbers
setting.description: Allows you to turn off the public display of version numbers in MyBB.

setting.name: captchaimage
setting.title: CAPTCHA Images for Registration & Posting
setting.description: If yes, and GD is installed, an image will be shown during registration and posting where users are required to enter the text contained within the image to continue. This helps prevent automated registrations and postings.

setting.name: reportmethod
setting.title: Reported Posts Medium
setting.description: Please select from the list how you want reported posts to be dealt with. Storing them in the database is probably the better of the options listed.
setting.optionscode: radio db=Stored in the Database pms=Sent as Private Messages email=Sent via Email

setting.name: statslimit
setting.title: Stats Limit
setting.description: The number of threads to show on the stats page for most replies and most views.

setting.name: decpoint
setting.title: Decimal Point
setting.description: The decimal point you use in your region.

setting.name: thousandssep
setting.title: Thousands Numeric Separator
setting.description: The punctuation you want to use . (for example, the setting ',' with the number 1200 will give you a number such as 1,200)

settinggroup.name: mailsettings
settinggroup.title: Mail Settings
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to control various aspects of the MyBB mail system, such as sending with PHP mail or with a off server SMTP server.

setting.name: mail_handler
setting.title: Mail handler
setting.description: How would you want to send your mails?

setting.name: smtp_host
setting.title: SMTP hostname
setting.description: The SMTP hostname you want to send through.

setting.name: smtp_port
setting.title: SMTP port
setting.description: The SMTP port number you want to send through.

setting.name: smtp_user
setting.title: SMTP username
setting.description: The SMTP username.

setting.name: smtp_pass
setting.title: SMTP password
setting.description: The SMTP password.

setting.name: smtp_encrypt
setting.title: SMTP encrypt
setting.description: If your password and username should be encrypted with base64 encryption, this is not supported by all servers.

setting.name: secure_smtp
setting.title: SMTP encrypted connection
setting.description: Is the server you are trying to send mail through using encrypted connection? Select here.

settinggroup.name: memberlist
settinggroup.title: Member List
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to control various aspects of the board member listing (memberlist.php), such as how many members to show per page, and which features to enable or disable.

setting.name: enablememberlist
setting.title: Enable Member List Functionality
setting.description: If you wish to disable the member list on your board, set this option to no.

setting.name: membersperpage
setting.title: Members Per Page
setting.description: The number of members to show per page on the member list.

setting.name: default_memberlist_sortby
setting.title: Default Sort Field
setting.description: Select the field that you want members to be sorted by default.
setting.optionscode: select regdate=Registration Date postnum=Post Count username=Username

setting.name: default_memberlist_order
setting.title: Default Sort Order
setting.description:
Select the order that you want members to be sorted by default.
Ascending: A-Z / beginning-end
Descending: Z-A / end-beginning

setting.name: portal_announcementsfid
setting.title: Forum ID to pull announcements from
setting.description: Please enter the forum ids (fid) of the forum(s) you wish to pull the announcements from. Separate them with a comma (,).

setting.name: portal_numannouncements
setting.title: Number of announcements to show
setting.description: Please enter the number of announcements to show on the main page.

setting.name: portal_showwelcome
setting.title: Show the Welcome box
setting.description: Do you want to show the welcome box to visitors / users.

setting.name: portal_showpms
setting.title: Show the number of PMs to users
setting.description: Do you want to show the number of private messages the current user has in their pm system.

setting.name: portal_showstats
setting.title: Show forum statistics
setting.description: Do you want to show the total number of posts, threads, members and the last registered member on the portal page?

setting.name: portal_showwol
setting.title: Show Who's Online
setting.description: Do you want to show the 'Who's online' information to users when they visit the portal page?

setting.name: portal_showsearch
setting.title: Show Search Box
setting.description: Do you want to show the search box, allowing users to quickly search the forums on the portal?

setting.name: portal_showdiscussions
setting.title: Show Latest Discussions
setting.description: Do you wish to show the current forum discussions on the portal page?

setting.name: portal_showdiscussionsnum
setting.title: Number of latest discussions to show
setting.description: Please enter the number of current forum discussions to show on the portal page.

settinggroup.name: posting
settinggroup.title: Posting
settinggroup.description: These options control the various elements in relation to posting messages on the forums.

setting.name: minmessagelength
setting.title: Minimum Message Length
setting.description: The minimum number of characters to post.

setting.name: maxmessagelength
setting.title: Maximum Message Length
setting.description: The maximum number of characters to allow in a message. A setting of 0 allows an unlimited length.

setting.name: maxposts
setting.title: Maximum Posts Per Day
setting.description: This is the total number of posts allowed per user per day. 0 for unlimited.

setting.name: postfloodcheck
setting.title: Post Flood Checking
setting.description: Set to on if you want to enable flood checking for posts. Specify the time between posts below.

setting.name: postfloodsecs
setting.title: Post Flood Time
setting.description: Set the time (in seconds) users have to wait between posting, to be in effect; the option above must be on.

setting.name: postmergemins
setting.title: Post Merge Time
setting.description: With this enabled, posts posted within x minutes by the same author right after each other, will be merged. Set the time limit (in minutes) to merge posts. Set to 0 or leave blank to disable this feature. Default: 60

setting.name: postmergefignore
setting.title: Merge Forums to Ignore
setting.description: Forums, seperated by a comma, to exclude from the auto merge feature. Leave blank to disable.

setting.name: postmergeuignore
setting.title: Merge Usergroups to Ignore
setting.description: Usergroups, seperated by a comma, to exclude from the merge feature. Default: 4 (Administrator). Leave blank to disable.

setting.name: postmergesep
setting.title: Merge Seperator
setting.description: The Seperator to be used when merging two message Default: '[hr]'

setting.name: logip
setting.title: Log Posting IP Addresses
setting.description: Do you wish to log ip addresses of users who post, and who to you want to show ip addresses to.
setting.optionscode: radio no=Do not log IP hide=Show to Admins & Mods show=Show to all Users

setting.name: showeditedby
setting.title: Show 'edited by' Messages
setting.description: Once a post is edited by a regular user, do you want to show the edited by message?

setting.name: showeditedbyadmin
setting.title: Show 'edited by' Message for Forum Staff
setting.description: Do you want to show edited by messages for forum staff when they edit their posts?

setting.name: maxpostimages
setting.title: Maximum Images per Post
setting.description: Enter the maximum number of images (including smilies) a user can put in their post. Set to 0 to disable this.

setting.name: subscribeexcerpt
setting.title: Amount of Characters for Subscription Previews
setting.description: How many characters of the post do you want to send with the email notification of a new reply.

setting.name: maxattachments
setting.title: Maximum Attachments Per Post
setting.description: The maximum number of attachments a user is allowed to upload per post.

setting.name: attachthumbnails
setting.title: Show Attached Thumbnails in Posts
setting.description: Do you want to show the generated thumbnails for attached images inside the posts?

setting.name: attachthumbh
setting.title: Attached Thumbnail Maximum Height
setting.description: Enter the height that attached thumbnails should be generated at.

setting.name: attachthumbw
setting.title: Attached Thumbnail Maximum Width
setting.description: Enter the width that attached thumbnails should be generated at.

setting.name: edittimelimit
setting.title: Edit Time Limit
setting.description: The number of minutes until regular users cannot edit their own posts (if they have the permission). Enter 0 (zero) for no limit.

setting.name: wordwrap
setting.title: Number of Characters before Word Wrapping Occurs
setting.description: The maximum number of characters that can be present in a word before a space is automatically inserted. (helps preservation of the forum layout). Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: polloptionlimit
setting.title: Maximum Poll Option Length
setting.description: The maximum length that each poll option can be. (Set to 0 to disable).

setting.name: maxpolloptions
setting.title: Maximum Number of Poll Options
setting.description: The maximum number of options for polls that users can post.

setting.name: enablereputation
setting.title: Enable Reputation Functionality
setting.description: If you wish to disable the reputation system on your board, set this option to no.

setting.name: repsperpage
setting.title: Reputation Comments Per Page
setting.description: Here you can enter the number of reputation comments to show per page on the reputation system

settinggroup.name: privatemessaging
settinggroup.title: Private Messaging
settinggroup.description: Various options with relation to the MyBB Private Messaging system (private.php) can be managed and set here.

setting.name: enablepms
setting.title: Enable Private Messaging Functionality
setting.description: If you wish to disable the private messaging system on your board, set this option to no.

setting.name: pmsallowhtml
setting.title: Allow HTML
setting.description: Selecting yes will allow HTML to be used in private messages.

setting.name: pmsallowmycode
setting.title: Allow MyCode
setting.description: Selecting yes will allow MyCode to be used in private messages.

setting.name: pmsallowsmilies
setting.title: Allow Smilies
setting.description: Selecting yes will allow Smilies to be used in private messages.

setting.name: pmsallowimgcode
setting.title: Allow [img] Code
setting.description: Selecting yes will allow [img] Code to be used in private messages.

settinggroup.name: server
settinggroup.title: Server and Optimization Options
settinggroup.description: These options allow you to set various server and optimization preferences allowing you to reduce the load on your server, and gain better performance on your board.

setting.name: seourls
setting.title: Enable search engine friendly URLs?
setting.description: Search engine friendly URLs change the MyBB links to shorter URLs which search engines prefer and are easier to type. showthread.php?tid=1 becomes thread1.html. Once this setting is enabled you need to make sure you have the MyBB .htaccess in your MyBB root directory (or the equivilent for your web server). Automatic detection may not work on all servers. Please see The MyBB wiki for assistance.

setting.name: gzipoutput
setting.title: Use GZip Page Compression?
setting.description: Do you want to compress pages in GZip format when they are sent to the browser? This means quicker downloads for your visitors, and less traffic usage for you.

setting.name: gziplevel
setting.title: GZip Page Compression Level
setting.description: Set the level for GZip Page Compression from 0-9. (0=no compression, 9=maximum compression). This will only take effect if GZip Page Compression is enabled above and if your PHP version is newer than 4.2. If you use an older version of PHP, the default compression level of the zlib library will be used instead.

setting.name: standardheaders
setting.title: Send Standard Headers
setting.description: With some web servers, this option can cause problems; with others, it is needed.

setting.name: nocacheheaders
setting.title: Send No Cache Headers
setting.description: With this option you can prevent caching of the page by the browser.

setting.name: redirects
setting.title: Friendly Redirection Pages
setting.description: This will enable friendly redirection pages instead of bumping the user directly to the page.

setting.name: load
setting.title: *NIX Load Limiting
setting.description: Limit the maximum server load before myBB rejects people. 0 for none. Recommended limit is 5.0.

setting.name: tplhtmlcomments
setting.title: Output template start/end comments?
setting.description: This will enable or disable the output of template start/end comments in the HTML.

setting.name: use_xmlhttprequest
setting.title: Enable XMLHttp request features?
setting.description: This will enable or disable the XMLHttp request features.

setting.name: useshutdownfunc
setting.title: Use PHP's Shutdown Functionality
setting.description: This setting for the most part is best left at the default which is detected upon installation. If thread indicators are not updating as well as other meta information, set this setting to 'No'

setting.title: CSS Medium
setting.description: Please select from the list how you want the theme and CSS data to be stored and retrieved.

setting.name: extraadmininfo
setting.title: Advanced Stats / Debug information
setting.description: Shows Server load, parse time, generation time, Gzip compression, etc on the bottom of all pages in the root folder. Please note that only administrators see this information.

setting.name: uploadspath
setting.title: Uploads Path
setting.description: The path used for all board uploads. It must be chmod 777 (on Unix servers).

setting.name: useerrorhandling
setting.title: Use Error Handling
setting.description: If you do not wish to use the integrated error handling for MyBB, you may turn this option off. However, it is reccommended that it stay on

setting.name: errorlogmedium

setting.optionscode: select warning=Warnings error=Errors both=Warnings and Errors

setting.name: errorloglocation
setting.title: Error Logging Location
setting.description: The location of the log to send errors to, if specified.

settinggroup.name: showteam
settinggroup.title: Show Forum Team Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage settings that affect the Forum Team Page (showteam.php).

setting.name: showteamleaders
setting.title: Separate Group Leaders
setting.description: If set to 'yes,' and if there are group leaders, they will be displayed above the other group members.

settinggroup.name: showthread
settinggroup.title: Show Thread Options
settinggroup.description: This section allows you to manage the various settings used on the thread display page (showthread.php) of your boards such as enabling and disabling different features.

setting.name: postsperpage
setting.title: Posts Per Page:
setting.description: The number of posts to display per page. We recommend its not higher than 20 for people with slower connections.

setting.name: userpppoptions
setting.title: User Selectable Posts Per Page
setting.description: If you would like to allow users to select how many posts are shown per page in a thread, enter the options they should be able to select separated with commas. If this is left blank they will not be able to choose how many posts are shown per page.

setting.name: threadreadcut
setting.title: Read Threads in Database (Days)
setting.description: The number of days that you wish to keep thread read information in the database. For large boards, we do not recommend a high number as the board will become slower. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: threadusenetstyle
setting.title: Usenet Style Thread View
setting.description: Selecting yes will cause posts to look similar to how posts look in USENET. No will cause posts to look the modern way.

setting.name: quickreply
setting.title: Show Quick Reply Form
setting.description: Allows you to set whether or not the quick reply form will be shown at the bottom of threads.

setting.name: multiquote
setting.title: Show Multi-quote Buttons
setting.description: The multi-quote button allows users to select a series of posts then click Reply and have those posts quoted in their message.

setting.name: showsimilarthreads
setting.title: Show 'Similar Threads' Table
setting.description: The Similar Threads table shows threads that are relevant to the thread being read. You can set the relevancy below.

setting.name: similarityrating
setting.title: Similar Threads Relevancy Rating
setting.description: This allows you to limit similar threads to ones more relevant (0 being not relevant). This number should not be over 10 and should not be set low (<5) for large forums.

setting.name: similarlimit
setting.title: Similar Threads Limit
setting.description: Here you can change the total amount of similar threads to be shown in the similar threads table. It is recommended that it is not over 15 for 56k users.

settinggroup.name: member
settinggroup.title: User Registration and Profile Options
settinggroup.description: Here you can control various settings with relation to user account registration and account management.

setting.name: disableregs
setting.title: Disable Registrations
setting.description: Allows you to turn off the capability for users to register with one click.

setting.name: regtype
setting.title: Registration Method
setting.description: Please select the method of registration to use when users register.
setting.optionscode: select instant=Instant Activation verify=Send Email Verification randompass=Send Random Password admin=Administrator Activation

setting.name: minnamelength
setting.title: Minimum Username Length
setting.description: The minimum number of characters a username can be when a user registers.

setting.name: maxnamelength
setting.title: Maximum Username Length
setting.description: The maximum number of characters a username can be when a user registers.

setting.name: minpasswordlength
setting.title: Minimum Password Length
setting.description: The minimum number of characters a password should contain.

setting.name: maxpasswordlength
setting.title: Maximum Password Length
setting.description: The maximum number of characters a password should contain.

setting.name: customtitlemaxlength
setting.title: Custom User Title Maximum Length
setting.description: Maximum length a user can enter for the custom user title.

setting.name: betweenregstime
setting.title: Time Between Registrations
setting.description: The amount of time (in hours) to disallow registrations for users who have already registered an account under the same ip address.

setting.name: maxregsbetweentime
setting.title: Maximum Registrations Per IP Address
setting.description: This option allows you to set the maximum amount of times a certain user can register within the timeframe specified above.

setting.name: failedlogincount
setting.title: Number of times to allow failed logins
setting.description: The number of times to allow someone to attempt to login. 0 to disable

setting.name: failedlogintime
setting.title: Time between failed logins
setting.description: The amount of time (in minutes) before someone can try to login again, after they have failed to login the first time. Used if value above is not 0.

setting.name: failedlogintext
setting.title: Display number of failed logins
setting.description: Do you wish to display a line of text telling the user how many more login attempts they have?

setting.name: usereferrals
setting.title: Use Referrals System
setting.description: Do you want to use the user referrals system on these forums?

setting.name: sigmycode
setting.title: Allow myCode in Signatures
setting.description: Do you want to allow myCode to be used in users' signatures?

setting.name: maxsigimages
setting.title: Maximum Number of Images per Signature
setting.description: Enter the maximum number of images (including smilies) a user can put in their signature. Set to 0 to disable images in signatures altogether.

setting.name: sigsmilies
setting.title: Allow Smilies in Signatures
setting.description: Do you want to allow smilies to be used in users' signatures?

setting.name: sightml
setting.title: Allow HTML in Signatures
setting.description: Do you want to allow HTML to be used in users' signatures?

setting.name: sigimgcode
setting.title: Allow [img] Code in Signatures
setting.description: Do you want to allow [img] code to be used in users' signatures?

setting.name: siglength
setting.title: Length limit in Signatures
setting.description: The maximum number of characters a user can place in a signature.

setting.name: sigcountmycode
setting.title: MyCode affects signature length
setting.description: Do you want myCode to be counted as part of the limit when users use myCode in their signature?

setting.name: maxavatardims
setting.title: Maximum Avatar Dimensions
setting.description: The maximum dimensions that an avatar can be, in the format of widthxheight. If this is left blank then there will be no dimension restriction.

setting.name: avatarsize
setting.title: Max Uploaded Avatar Size
setting.description: Maximum file size (in kilobytes) of uploaded avatars.

setting.name: avatarresizing
setting.title: Avatar Resizing Mode
setting.description: If you wish to automatically resize all large avatars, provide users the option of resizing their avatar, or not resize avatars at all you can change this setting.
setting.optionscode: select auto=Automatically resize large avatars user=Give users the choice of resizing large avatars disabled=Disable this feature

setting.name: avatardir
setting.title: Avatar Directory
setting.description: The directory where your avatars are stored. These are used in the avatar list in the User CP.

setting.name: avataruploadpath
setting.title: Avatar Upload Path
setting.description: This is the path where custom avatars will be uploaded to. This directory must be chmod 777 (writable) for uploads to work.

settinggroup.name: whosonline
settinggroup.title: Who's Online
settinggroup.description: Various settings regarding the Who is Online functionality.

setting.name: wolcutoffmins
setting.title: Cut-off Time (mins)
setting.description: The number of minutes before a user is marked offline. Recommended: 15.

setting.name: refreshwol
setting.title: Refresh Who's online page Time (mins)
setting.description: The number of minutes before the "Who's online" page refreshes. 0 is disabled.

settinggroup.name: search
settinggroup.title: Search System
settinggroup.description: The various settings in this group allow you to make changes to the built in search mechanism for threads and posts in MyBB,

setting.name: searchtype
setting.title: Search Type
setting.description: Please select the type of search system you wish to use. You can either chose between "Standard", or "Full Text" (depending on your database). Fulltext searching is more powerful than the standard MyBB searching and quicker too.

setting.name: searchfloodtime
setting.title: Search Flood Time (seconds)
setting.description: Enter the time in seconds for the minimum allowed interval for searching. This prevents users from overloading your server by constantly performing searches. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.name: minsearchword
setting.title: Minimum Search Word Length
setting.description: Enter the minimum number of characters an individual word in a search query can be. Set to 0 to disable (and accept the hard limit default of 3 for standard searching and 4 for MySQL fulltext searching). If you use MySQL fulltext searching and set this lower than the MySQL setting - MySQL will override it.
